translated: Birth Stories
The Four-Part Collection🔽The Chapter on the Corrupter of Households
The Godha King Birth Story
Thinking he was an ascetic,
I approached him, thinking he was a monk;
He struck me with his staff,
just as I am not a monk.”
“What do you care for your dreadlocks, fool?
What do you care for your antelope-skin cloak?
You’re full of filth inside,
yet you rub yourself down outside.”
“Come, Godha, turn back!
Eat rice with curry;
I have oil and salt,
and plenty of black pepper.
I’ll go even further,
to a termite-mound twenty stories high;
You praise oil and salt,
but black pepper is bad for me.”
The Godha King Birth Story is the fifth.
